item.title: J. Robert Oppenheimer's Defense of Humanity
item.description: After helping invent the atomic bomb, the physicist spent decades thinking about how to preserve civilization from technological dangers, offering crucial lessons for the age of AI.

item.title: Talkin' 'Bout Our Generations: How They Shape (Almost) Everything in 2023
item.description: Are you a boomer? Millennial? A member of Gen Z or X? ​As this collection of 20 stories explores, the ways we eat, dress, travel and scroll all depend a lot on when we were born.

item.title: Crypto exchange Binance is cutting a big chunk of its workforce. Over 1,000 people have been fired in recent weeks, according to a person familiar with the moves.
item.description: Crypto exchange Binance is cutting a big chunk of its workforce. Over 1,000 people have been fired in recent weeks, according to a person familiar with the moves.

item.title: A total of $39 billion in federal student debt will be forgiven as part of a one-time adjustment to loan repayment plans announced last year, the Education Department said.
item.description: A total of $39 billion in federal student debt will be forgiven as part of a one-time adjustment to loan repayment plans announced last year, the Education Department said.

item.title: A dangerous heat wave stretching across the southern U.S. had 93 million people facing what forecasters said could be a scorching, potentially deadly weekend.
item.description: A dangerous heat wave stretching across the southern U.S. had 93 million people facing what forecasters said could be a scorching, potentially deadly weekend.

item.title: An appeals court denied a last-ditch bid by the FTC to halt Microsoft's planned acquisition of videogame publisher Activision Blizzard.
item.description: An appeals court denied a last-ditch bid by the FTC to halt Microsoft’s planned acquisition of videogame publisher Activision Blizzard.

item.title: National Amusements, the family holding company of Shari Redstone, is in negotiations with creditors to renegotiate some of its debt, after disclosing it is facing heightened financial risks.
item.description: National Amusements, the family holding company of Shari Redstone, is in negotiations with creditors to renegotiate some of its debt, after disclosing it is facing heightened financial risks.

item.title: Biden raised a combined $72 million with the DNC since the launch of his re-election bid in April, his campaign said, pulling in more than the leading Republicans running for the 2024 nomination.
item.description: Biden raised a combined $72 million with the DNC since the launch of his re-election bid in April, his campaign said, pulling in more than the leading Republicans running for the 2024 nomination.

item.title: Putin said the Wagner paramilitary group "simply doesn't exist," as he moves to dismantle an organization that was critical to Moscow's war effort in Ukraine before it turned on the Russian establishment in a short-lived mutiny.
item.description: Putin said the Wagner paramilitary group “simply doesn’t exist,” as he moves to dismantle an organization that was critical to Moscow’s war effort in Ukraine before it turned on the Russian establishment in a short-lived mutiny.

item.title: The Republican-controlled House narrowly passed a $886 billion defense-policy bill loaded with measures restricting abortion access, transgender healthcare and diversity efforts in the military, as McCarthy kept his party largely united amid strong Democratic opposition.
item.description: The Republican-controlled House narrowly passed a $886 billion defense-policy bill loaded with measures restricting abortion access, transgender healthcare and diversity efforts in the military, as McCarthy kept his party largely united amid strong Democratic opposition.

item.title: Tucker Carlson and former White House adviser Neil Patel are seeking to raise funds to start a media company that would potentially use Twitter as its backbone, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Tucker Carlson and former White House adviser Neil Patel are seeking to raise funds to start a media company that would potentially use Twitter as its backbone, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: The Dow and Nasdaq recorded their best weekly gains since March, rising 2.3% and 3.3%, respectively, while the S&P 500 added 2.4% in a broad-based advance.
item.description: The Dow and Nasdaq recorded their best weekly gains since March, rising 2.3% and 3.3%, respectively, while the S&P 500 added 2.4% in a broad-based advance.

item.title: Big U.S. banks presented a picture of a resilient economy, with consumers and businesses continuing to spend and borrow even after a lightning-fast rise in interest rates. JPMorgan, Wells Fargo and Citigroup all beat expectations for quarterly profit and revenue.
item.description: Big U.S. banks presented a picture of a resilient economy, with consumers and businesses continuing to spend and borrow even after a lightning-fast rise in interest rates. JPMorgan, Wells Fargo and Citigroup all beat expectations for quarterly profit and revenue.

item.title: A federal appeals court temporarily blocked a July 4 ruling that limited the U.S. government's communications with social-media companies about their online content.
item.description: A federal appeals court temporarily blocked a July 4 ruling that limited the U.S. government’s communications with social-media companies about their online content.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: What’s News: Business & Finance

item.title: The 2024 Election Is a Fight Over America's Way of Life
item.description: GOP voters see a country corrupted by liberal ideals.

item.title: Weeks of Extreme Heat Strain Small Businesses and Economy
item.description: Heat waves stretching across large parts of the globe are testing power grids and shutting businesses that can’t keep their workers cool.

item.title: Would Allies Fight With U.S. for Taiwan? Japan Is Wary
item.description: American and Japanese military officials have been working on a plan for a conflict over Taiwan for more than a year, but this central question remains unanswered.

item.title: Pepper...and Salt
item.description: Pepper...and Salt
